website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe floor stand that delivers a terrific combination of style, function and versatility.
pros: Designed for use with all cell phones, tablets and e-readers
Includes a swing-arm that quickly swings and can be folded down when not in use
Jointed tablet holder tilts from side to side and rotates 360 degrees for landscape and portrait viewing
cons: Less stable than many comparable options
Won't necessarily fit under a recliner chair

customer_reviews.title: Love this stand
customer_reviews.text: I use this while seated in my La-z-boy recliner or when I ride my exercise bike. It is great. My husband's comment, you should have bought one years ago. It also works when I want to work standing up or seated on my couch with a friend. I included a photo showing a blue 12 inch ruler on the laptop holder. I adjusted one arm out as far as it would go. I use the stand with laptops that measure 12 inches across and the arms are adjusted all the way in like the arm in the left in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Holds my 17” 2011 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I use this stand for watching videos and reading my e-textbooks while comfortably lying in bed. I have my mouse on the bed with me and it works pretty well against the sheets. The mouse pad is too high and not adjustable to be useful. It holds my 17” MacBook Pro. I couldn’t give it five stars because of the mouse pad issue and the laptop size limit listed in the specifications. My laptop hovers over my bed while I’m using the stand which makes me less paranoid, however, I never feel comfortable swinging the arm out away from my bed since the specs say it wasn’t designed to hold a computer as big as mine. Have no regrets purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Good for stable, hands free utility
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a handy stationary stand. Well balanced. I'm using it on a laptop that is slightly bigger than recommended. Not as versatile as I was expecting but the ad was accurate. I would have preferred if the arm articulated around the axis, if the arm reached a bit farther and if it was taller. Well built with good fit and finish. Well packaged by a company who clearly takes pride in presentation. Would recommend with noted conditions
customer_reviews.author: buybuylisa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment. Just what I needed to save my ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment. Just what I needed to save my neck and back from looking down all the time. ONE COMPLAINT: The instructions are terrible, especially for the elderly who probably read more and need it most. The problem is the print or font is way to tiny. It took 2 of us longer than it should have to assemble: one to use the magnifying glass to read, and one to do it! Vendors need to consider your customers. Make the instructions easy for the elderly, if not all who need them.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Using this from a typical recliner is NOT realistic - ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this from a typical recliner is NOT realistic - The arm does NOT swing at the connection to the pole, so the only horizontal movement is from the outer arm which extremely limits positioning - The arm comes out above the center of the two legs. Since the inner arm does NOT have any circular motion from the pole, positioning the two legs around the floor rails that are the feet of most recliners while placing the device holding tray anywhere close to a usable position is not realistic. It is awkward to use even with a couch. If it had wheels, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: don123

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that works to alleviate neck strain. I have tried other devices to hold my laptop at eye level. This is the first that really delivers. Sturdy, easy to adjust, works well with my easy chair. The feet of the stand easily go under my chair. The arm rotates for many positions. Easy to move out of the way when I want to get up from the chair. I don't use it to stand while working. I don't know if it would hold laptop high enough. Quick and easy clips hold the laptop securely. Well made product. A friend who is mechanically inclined put it together in less than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Reetz

customer_reviews.title: Works for indoor cycling trainers when laptop is needed.
customer_reviews.text: This stand works perfectly for the purpose I bought it, which was to hold a laptop while riding a bicycle on rollers. Should work the same for any type of trainer. Packaging was excellent, as stated in other reviews. Instructions were clear and installation went quickly and smoothly. I'm impressed with the overall quality and material.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older stand with this one. It is very well made of quality materials and assembly was easy enough. It is more attractive than the photo makes it appear. My old stand was much heavier, but it could be swiveled away without moving the base. This one only swivels partially and then it really isn’t intended to do so. Now, I just pick it up and move it back out of the way when I want to get out of my chair. More difficult, but it is surprising how we can be spoiled by how something works and find it difficult to do it another way.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Decent Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Which is was easier to adjust height instead of always having to unscrew middle to adjust then re-tighten. Would be nice if it had wheels. Also the V-Shape feet sometimes makes it feel unstandble when i fold arm in with the laptop because of weight distribution to one side or the other will tilt and possible drop the computer. Everything from tightening the laptop to the stand to height adjustment use screw in knobs.

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see the arm a little bit longer
customer_reviews.text: While the stand if very solid, I would like to see the arm a little bit longer. Have to move close to the edge of the bed to use this. The larger tablet mount could also use a little more clearance, as the iPad Pro 12 only fits in the mount without any cover. That means I have to take the cover off each time I want to use the stand. Otherwise it is a nice product.

customer_reviews.title: It was quite sturdy and did everything it said it would do

However, just because it didn't meet my needs, doesn't mean it won't meet yours of sturdiness and reliability. I do wish the 'thingys' that prevent the computer from falling off, were height adjustable because I had a hard time typing (they got in my way because of their height).and it would be nice if the tray that the computer rest on had greater adjustability.

product_meta.title: UPERGO Floor Stand for Cell Phones, Tablets, Laptops, and E-Readers, Height Adjustable, 360 Degree Rotating(UP-8), Silver
product_meta.description:
●Perfect Performance

Excellent for home, classroom, dorm, or office use, this durable and exquisite piece of furniture embodies the need to stay mobile, stay connected and stay hands-free.




●Adjustable Height

Adjustable height bar give you versatility when using your tablet, whether you need it while sitting, standing or even at a different orientation.




●Any Viewing Angle

Jointed tablet holder tilts side to side and rotates 360 degrees for landscape and portrait viewing.




●Stable & Steady

The stand base is made of study aluminum alloy, so it will not easily tip over.
feature_bullets: Super sturdy construction minimizes annoying bouncing while surfing or typing, and protects your valuable device from tipping over.
Swing-arm quickly swings and folds when not in use, or to exit your furniture.
3 pieces of mount holders compatible with all cell phones, tablets and E-readers, 1 piece of laptop tray.
Package contents: 1 set of UPERGO floor stand, instruction manual, and free lifetime technical support.
